content.contents: a fond memory of my beloved father.

i had a betta fish when i was a child (known also as a siamese fighting fish). it was red, blue and purple. i named him 'stringy' because his fins were, well, stringy. he was the first pet i had aside from the family dog and cat. a real sweet fish. as sweet as a fish could be, anyway.
i was responsible with him and i did feed him when needs be, but he had a brief life, only two years i believe, which is on the low end for such a fish.

i remember the morning he died. my mother was in the kitchen. i went into the kitchen to feed him - stringy - and there he was, afloat at the top of the tank, upside-down. i knew what a dead fish looked like. i think i may have turned to my mom and said, 'i think stringy is dead...' all i really remember is bursting into tears. i loved that fish.

my dad came along and saw how upset i was, so he proposed we have a fish funeral. at the time we were situated in a small apartment in Raleigh, North Carolina, i think it was 'marq at crabtree' - though it was called something else when we lived there, back in... 2007? regardless, we were a short walk from this area where a bridge went over a small river. we went to this river - yes, a river, we didn't flush my poor boy - and put him in the water, and my dad said a little prayer for him, that God would guide him to 'fish heaven' or, something along those lines. this was almost 20 years ago now so you'll forgive me for paraphrasing.
it's a nice memory, this one. a good example of my father being a good father.
i miss him often, and dearly.
